laboratory_examinations.findings: Plasma Na+ was 122 mmol/L, K+ was 9 mmol/L, HCO3- was 13.5 mmol/L, and glucose was 48 mg/dL (2.6 mmol/L).
Cortisol, 28 mg/dL (772.8 nmol/L); 17-hydroxyprogesterone, 10,000 ng/dL (302.6 nmol/L); and ACTH, 450 pg/mL (99 pmol/L).
Cortisol, 8 mg/dL (220.8 nmol/L); 17-hydroxyprogesterone, 4200 ng/dL (127.3 nmol/L); testosterone, 65 ng/dL (2.9 nmol/L); DHEA-S, 519 mg/dL (13.4 mmol/L); and ACTH, 438 pg/mL (96.4 pmol/L).

DHEA-S was high (313–431 mg/dL; 8.5–11.7 mmol/L), whereas androstenedione and 17-hydroxyprogesterone were only slightly increased (20–71.6 ng/dL; 267.7–700.7 ng/dL, respectively), and testosterone was at or below the detection limit (8.7 ng/dL; 0.3 nmol/L).

laboratory_examinations.procedure_name: Plasma LH, FSH, estradiol, and progesterone levels
laboratory_examinations.findings: Plasma LH, 14.1 IU/L; FSH, 5.1 IU/L; estradiol, 246 pmol/L; and progesterone, 1.0 nmol/L. All values are within the normal range for girls at Tanner stage 4.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: At 11.2 yr, the plasma progesterone level had risen to 7.4 pmol/L.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Cortisol, 26.6 mg/dL (734.1 nmol/L); 17-hydroxyprogesterone, 2263.9 ng/dL (68.5 nmol/L); DHEA-S, 868.9 mg/dL (23.6 mmol/L); androstenedione, 2552 ng/dL (89.3 nmol/L); testosterone, 124.3 ng/dL (5.54 nmol/L); Plasma Na+ was 125 mmol/L and K+ was 7.5 mmol/L.
DHEA, 296.4 nmol/L (normal, <22.73 nmol/L); 17-hydroxyprogesterone, 65.1 nmol/L; androstenedione, 33.3 nmol/L; and cortisol, 24.2 nmol/L.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: These values did not increase after administration of 250 mg synthetic ACTH.
